definition: thin/to lose weight/(of clothing) tight/(of meat) lean/(of land) unproductive

sentences.english: I just sized up the short and gaunt guy in front of me.
sentences.chinese: 我仔细地打量着眼前这个骨瘦如柴的家伙。

sentences.english: I remember her as a stick-thin teenager.
sentences.chinese: 我的记忆里，她是个骨瘦如柴的青少年。

sentences.english: I seized her bony hand with a lump in my throat.
sentences.chinese: 我握住她骨瘦如柴的手，伤心得哽咽欲泣。

sentences.english: He is reduced to skin and bones.
Once upon a time, there was a skinny boy who was bullied at school.
sentences.chinese: 曾经，有一个骨瘦如柴的小男孩，在学校受到了欺负。

sentences.english: You'll get nothing for you horse. Who's going to buy and old bag of bones like that?
sentences.chinese: 你的马卖不出价，谁会买你那匹骨瘦如柴的老马？

sentences.english: The skinny boy is, of course, Brazil.
sentences.chinese: 这个骨瘦如柴的男孩就是巴西。

sentences.english: Becomes gradually thin, one day finally faints the roadside, suffocates.
sentences.chinese: 渐渐地变得骨瘦如柴，一天终于昏倒路旁，奄奄一息。

sentences.english: One year after his diagnosis, my dad was skeletal.
sentences.chinese: 确诊一年以后，父亲已是骨瘦如柴。

sentences.english: They are only skinny girls with the big hair and poofy lips.
sentences.chinese: 不过是一群烫发涂唇，骨瘦如柴的女孩。

definition: to be all skin and bones (idiom)/also written 皮包骨[pi2 bao1 gu3]
yellow face, emaciated body (idiom); malnourished and sickly in appearance
looking or feeling sickly/weak and dispirited through illness
messy hair and dirty face/bad appearance
